snippet: Heading for the Game Developers Conference in San Francisco, the 190 participants in this effort — some from as far away as Zambia — spent 52 hours immersed in virtual worlds.
abstract: Video game designers, artists and programmers from around world participate in Train Jam, collaborative session aboard train from Chicago to Emeryville, Calif, as they travel to 30th Game Developers Conference in San Francisco; 52-hour trip yields roughly 50 games that will be playable at conference.
lead_paragraph: Heading for the Game Developers Conference in San Francisco, the 190 participants in this effort — some from as far away as Zambia — spent 52 hours immersed in virtual worlds.

headline.main: Train Jam: Strangers on a Train, Creating Video Games
headline.print_headline: Strangers on a Train, Busily Creating Video Games
